dublin_core.dcvalue: The anatomic complexity of the maxillofacial region makes the retrieval of foreign bodies a daunting task for the maxillofacial Surgeon Moreover the inability of 2 dimensional imaging to precisely locate foreign bodies makes it challenging The anatomic proximity of critical structures and esthetic considerations limits the access and thus poses a greater challenge for the surgeon in cases of foreign body retrieval Hereby we propose a simple technique and a case report to support the retrieval of small Under5 mm greatest dimension objects from the maxillofacial region The present technique uses a 2 dimensional mobile C arm Fluoroscopy and a needle triangulation method to precisely locate a loosened miniplate screw in the mandibular angle region
The journal of contemporary dental practice
C-arm fluoroscopy: a reliable modality for retrieval of foreign bodies in the maxillofacial region.
